results.title: Support Specialist
results.description:
Sunroom Rentals is a property-tech startup, headquartered in central Austin. At Sunroom, we are responsible for leasing thousands of homes and apartments. We've created a platform that enables renters to self-tour properties and apply inside our app.

We believe that renting a home should be as easy as booking a hotel. We're on a mission to reinvent leasing and to empower renters. Sunroom Rentals was started by the founders of Favor Delivery Ben & Zac. Their last company, Favor had 50,000 delivery drivers at the time it was sold to HEB Grocery. You'll be joining a super-talented, motivated, fun team, looking to change the game for renters!

We have raised over $11 million from top-tier investors including NextGen, Gigafund, Draper Associates & Founders Fund. Our investors have also backed the likes of SpaceX, Tesla, and Facebook.

Get in the know:

  • This March, Sunroom raised millions to grow across Texas, PR Here.

  • Renters love our 5-Star iPhone app -- thousands of renters use us in Austin, Texas, and we’re expanding to more cities.

 

Our Support Specialist serves a variety of critical functions for Sunroom partners and clients, primarily leasing out our listings by working with interested renters to drive them to tour and then apply to our homes. This role requires delivering stellar customer support and sales-adjacent activities. This position will work remotely from Mexico on a permanent basis.

 

What you'll be doing:

  • Inside Sales: You'll assist our Partners and Account Management team by proactively reaching out to leads, and getting our properties leased to qualified renters, as quickly as possible. You’ll help our renters arrange property tours, apply for homes, and submit applications, and you’ll be an expert at answering questions about the homes and the Sunroom process. You'll communicate with interested renters by text, email, phone, and social media platforms.

  • Phone Support: You’ll answer incoming calls from renters and outside agents, to answer questions about listings and the tour & application processes. You’ll also make outgoing calls to follow up with interested renters and agents.

  • Additional Client Support: As time allows, you may also assist with other activities to support our clients and growing team.

Why you'll love working here:

  • Innovative Company: You'll be joining a small but growing team, at an extremely innovative company that is changing the real estate market. You'll work with creative leaders with a proven track record of creating successful companies.

  • Salary: This role starts at $800/month.

  • Supportive Team: We have an amazing team to help train you and support you as you advance.

  • Modern technology: We've developed software & CRM systems to deliver the best client experience. We're building tools from the ground up to make your job easier and more efficient.

  • New School Real Estate: Awesome work environment at a company with an inspiring vision. With an expanding customer and partner base, you will be part of the new apartment and home leasing era!

  • Growth Opportunities: We are expanding our teams quickly and hire from within as we grow!

  • Diversity: Sunroom Rentals values inclusion and diversity, and is committed to building a diverse workforce.

  • Full-Time: We're looking for candidates who will be willing to work full-time, 6 days a week, with some weekend availability (schedule TBD and shifts will fall within the hours of 8am - 9pm CT each day of the week).

  • Bilingual: You are bilingual, fluent in both Spanish and English.

  • Proactive & Driven: You are driven to push for completion of the rental process, and you are not afraid to reach out by phone, text and email to potential renters. You proactively update team members on your work.

  • Adept Communicator: You are at ease communicating with renters and owners, whether via phone, email or text. You’re very comfortable making outbound calls to follow up with interested renters (leads).

  • Tech-Savvy: You are comfortable using and learning new technology. We have developed world-class proprietary software with many automated processes to help you do your work efficiently! You are used to having multiple applications and windows open while you work.

  • Highly Organized: You are highly organized, and able to track multiple moving pieces in a high-volume environment.

  • Follow-Through: You have a strong practice of follow-through and take the actions that you say you will.

  • Engaging and Empathetic: You are friendly, can easily interact with and engage potential renters. You understand the rewards as well as the challenges of the rental process from the renter’s perspective. You are also sensitive to the priorities of our owner partners, and provide them with thoroughly-vetted, high-quality rental candidates.

  • You are excited to be part of a whole new way to rent homes, and want to grow with an awesome company!

results.title: Customer Success Manager
results.description:
Leadfeeder is a remote first, fast growing international SaaS scale-up. We are on a mission to bring web intelligence into business. Simply put, Leadfeeder helps companies know more about their website visitors, which enables them to convert promising visitors into sales leads.

We’re excited to share that Leadfeeder has merged with Echobot, a leading provider of European Sales Intelligence. As a result, we now have 250+ team members based across 30+ countries and six offices across the US and Europe. Together, our companies are striving to be the leading sales intelligence and go-to-market platform in our core European and North American markets.

What sets us apart? We are a market leader with a solid business model ready to be scaled. Our data-driven and customer-centric approach keeps us grounded while providing a basis for sustainable and ambitious growth.

Are you a self-starter looking to learn and grow as part of a world-class team? Join our journey!

 

About this role

We are looking for a Customer Success Manager to join our rapidly growing CS team (over the last 12 months, we’ve added 10 new team members)! In this role, you will work with our client base in Sweden to ensure that they have the best experience using our product.

From the beginning of your time at Leadfeeder, we will work closely with you to ensure you succeed. From a 3 week onboarding process including time with senior leaders in the business, to ongoing personal development reviews, we’ve set up an effective system to help you to thrive in your new role.

We also have an office in Stockholm, so you can choose if you'd like to work from the office or home!

If you’re passionate about technology and serving customers, this might be the perfect opportunity for you!

 

Requirements

  • Native level fluency in English and Swedish
  • Minimum of 1 year of customer success or similar experience in a SaaS business
  • You have digital sales or marketing experience.
  • You have a good understanding of marketing analytics in general.
  • You have experience working in a B2B SaaS environment.
  • You are a self-starter who defaults to trying to find a solution to a problem.
  • You are 'commercially minded' and excited to search for expansion opportunities in your client base of ~150 clients; willing to show persistence in following up on expansion opportunities.
  • A healthy curiosity about technology - be interested to learn how the product works, how we could improve it as time passes.
  • Strong time management skills - you will be working with a client base of ~150 clients, so prioritisation is a must.
  • Strong presentation skills - this is a role that involves speaking to customers every single day, and our clients expect clear, concise support.
  • Strong verbal and written communication - customers can reach out to us via phone, email, support - we need to be performing at a consistently high level across all these mediums.

Nice to haves

  • Experience working with or using one of the major CRM integrations we use (Pipedrive, Salesforce, Dynamics, Hubspot especially).
  • Fluency in another Nordic/Scandinavian language
  • Experience with reporting tools such as GDS.
  • Experience with API solutions.

You are not expected to know everything right away, but you need to be seriously motivated to learn and have the right balance of knowledge and interests to enable you to flourish and grow in this role.

Responsibilities

As a Customer Success Manager you will:

  • Onboard new clients & help with implementation.
  • Coach existing clients to improve their sales and marketing processes.
  • Minimise churn in your client base.
  • Drive upsell opportunities in your client base together with Account Managers.

What we offer

  • An international and diverse work atmosphere
  • A competitive salary
  • Regular online team building activities to have fun with your colleagues
  • Company retreats - we’ve recently returned from a week together in Croatia!
  • Personal development plans as standard, allowing you to develop the skills you think are most important to succeed in your role, as well as regular 1-2-1 and group training.

If this role excites you and sounds like a great fit, please apply below!

results.title: Customer Support Associate
results.description:
Amper is a fast-growing tech company headquartered in Chicago’s River West neighborhood. We build a simple but powerful platform that helps manufacturers reduce costs, increase visibility and drive efficiency. We recently raised funds for our Series A and are looking to quickly grow our team and scale our company.

The customer support associate will work closely with our internal engineering and customer success teams to directly support our customers and escalate issues as necessary. You will be responsible for organizing and escalating issues to the engineering team, helping answer product questions and educating our customer base.

 

Locations: Remote or Chicago

 

What will you be doing?

  • Handle incoming customer questions and concerns via email and our Hubspot support portal.

  • Interface with internal sales and customer success teams to ensure pilots and existing customers are supported.

  • Work with the engineering team to escalate and investigate bugs and product questions.

  • Use Notion and other tools to manage internal processes and information.

 

Preferred Experience:

  • Strong problem-solving skills, with an ability to distill solutions from many sources of information.

  • Experience working in a customer service role.

  • Ability to learn new systems and tools quickly.

 

Some reasons you might like working with us:

  • Amper is a Series A funded startup, which means every team member is critical. This means that you’ll have responsibilities that directly impact our business—immediately.

  • We are a cross-functional team that thrives in collaborating and supporting colleagues.

  • Our vision is massive and we have the team, technology and customer base to support that growth.

  • We have an insanely talented team that is fast-paced and each in the top of their field.

  • We believe that building Amper is a marathon and not a short sprint and we support a balanced life.

  • You get to learn a lot very quickly and we trust you to operate with freedom in achieving your mission.

  • We don’t look at customers as “cash cows” but rather see them as long term partners in our journey to making the industry succeed. We detest the current model of how industrial sales are clunky and poorly designed for customers.

 

Here's why this might not be a fit for you:

  • You do not enjoy interacting with people. This is a customer facing role that requires you to take customer calls and triage work with your internal team.

  • You are unorganized, not a strong note taker, or poor communicator.

  • You are easily stressed or not used to fast-paced work.

  • You prefer to be a siloed worker.

  • You're not a hands-on individual or motivated to get stuff done quickly - no task is too small or too large for this role.

     

Benefits

  • Unlimited PTO, 2-week minimum - We value work-life balance where family and health come first. We have an open vacation policy, as we want everybody to feel supported, restored and ready to take on the day.

  • This position’s location is flexible. You can be fully remote, or partially remote and go into one of our co-working locations in Charlotte or downtown Chicago.

  • 401(k) plan

  • Health insurance (medical, vision, and dental)

  • Flexible work schedule

 

Compensation:

$30k - $40k, depending on experience.

 

If this role seems like a fit, we would love to learn more about your experience and goals.

results.title: Customer Success Engineer
results.description:
Amper is hiring an empathetic, diligent Customer Success Engineer (Continuous Improvement Consultant) who is excited about growing their client management career at an innovative, well-funded startup. We recently raised funds for our Series A and are looking to quickly grow our team and scale our company.

As a Customer Success Engineer at Amper, you will be responsible for onboarding and educating customers on how to use Amper in their factory to improve operations. You will guide customers along journeys to drive product utilization and help customers achieve their business objectives. Having knowledge of manufacturing and lean practices will be advantageous for this role.

 

Locations: Remote, Chicago, or Charlotte 

 

What will you be doing?

  • Ensure customer retention by proactively engaging with customers to increase satisfaction and product usage for assigned accounts.

  • Develop strong relationship with customers by understanding their business objectives and identifying opportunities for Amper to help.

  • Serve as an manufacturing expert within the Amper system and provide product trainings and consultations.

  • Relay intelligent product feedback from customers to our Product team.

  • Onboard new customers and guide them through their Amper journey.

  • Host weekly/monthly check-in meetings as well as Executive/Quarterly reviews.

  • Work cross-functionally with internal teams to triage customer questions.

     

Some reasons you might like working with us:

  • Amper is a Series A funded startup, which means every team member is critical. This means that you’ll have responsibilities that directly impact our business—immediately.

  • We are a cross-functional team that thrives in collaborating and supporting colleagues.

  • Our vision is massive and we have the team, technology and customer base to support that growth.

  • We have an insanely talented team that is fast-paced and each in the top of their field.

  • We believe that building Amper is a marathon and not a short sprint and we support a balanced life.

  • You get to learn a lot very quickly and we trust you to operate with freedom in achieving your mission.

  • We don’t look at customers as “cash cows” but rather see them as long term partners in our journey to making the industry succeed. We detest the current model of how industrial sales are clunky and poorly designed for customers.

     

Here are the skills you'll need to be successful:

  • 1+ years of Manufacturing Engineering/Continuous Improvement Experience (preferably CNC and Injection Molding) OR 1+ years experience in a Customer Success or customer facing role (preferably at a software or technology company)

  • Exceptional communication skills (oral and written) to educate customer on best practices.

  • Lean Manufacturing/Six Sigma is a plus.

  • Strong time management & organizational skills.

  • Ability to engage with multiple stakeholders to understand business goals and where Amper can help.

  • Ability to learn new technical products and become an expert in the manufacturing industry.

  • Experience working with a CRM or other relevant management software.

  • Ability to analyze (especially root cause analysis) and consult on customer data.

  • Ability to navigate with limited resources.

  • Experience using online meeting platforms Zoom, Google Meets and Microsoft Teams.

     

Here's why this might not be a fit for you:

  • You do not enjoy interacting with people. This is a customer facing role that requires you to take customer calls and triage work with your internal team.

  • You have limited manufacturing knowledge. This job requires you to speak with manufacturers, to understand the lingo and to be able to intelligently advise on best practices of the industry. Although it is not required, lack of experience can be a major challenge.

  • You dislike for analysis or working with numbers.

  • You are unorganized, not a strong note taker, or poor communicator.

  • You are easily stressed or not used to fast-paced work.

  • You prefer to be a siloed worker.

  • You're not a hands-on individual or motivated to get stuff done quickly - no task is too small or too large for this role. You may need to re-design presentations, build ROI models for a customer, or document boring (but essential to standardize) processes.

     

Benefits

  • Unlimited PTO, 2-week minimum - We value work-life balance where family and health come first. We have an open vacation policy, as we want everybody to feel supported, restored and ready to take on the day.

  • This position’s location is flexible. You can be fully remote, or partially remote and go into one of our co-working locations in Charlotte or downtown Chicago.

  • 401(k) plan

  • Health insurance (medical, vision, and dental)

  • Flexible work schedule

     

If this role seems like a fit, we would love to learn more about your experience and goals.

results.title: Customer Success Manager
results.description:
What this is all about

We are a global company focused on developing the best fulfillment & delivery technology in the world. We provide leading retailers such as Walmart, Falabella, and HEB with advanced software solutions to conquer the eCommerce market through flawless operations.

Our technology is designed to operate at a large scale, driving cost efficiencies and providing the most delightful digital customer experience, in line with the best providers in the world. We strive to help traditional retailers take on the digital world in just a few days.

Instaleap has been growing fast over the past two years despite its (at the time) nearly sole product focus. With what is now a leading technology and distinguishing product in the space, it’s time to scale our growth efforts.

 

What we bring to the table

  • A growing organization with beautiful (remote if desired) positions and possibilities for personal development

  • A challenging job that’ll be at the core of our growth ambitions

  • Paid-time-off (PTO) for 25 days

  • Rock solid onboarding that’ll set you up for success in your job

  • Mentoring and coaching by experienced SaaS leaders that can help you elevate your career

  • Monthly online events with International Team

  • Educational budget to support your studies or language courses

  • Flex schedule and remote first culture - We are a global team & we trust in your commitment and abilities.

Profile

As a Customer Success Manager, you will be responsible for leading the OPS Specialist team to achieve good results with customers, at the same time you will be our expert in sustaining good relationships with our customers at the Latam level driving Instaleap's growth in the market.

Your SuperPowers

  • Adaptive personality

  • Ability to complete full tasks- focus to consistently have high quality in getting to the best result possible (“go the extra mile”)

  • Problem-solving & decision-making skills

  • Product Expertise

  • Capacity for persuasion and negotiation

  • Assertive and effective communication.

  • High analytical capacity and results orientation.

  • Ability to work with cross-functional teams and lead processes

  • You are a timekeeper and a result oriented person.

What would I be doing?

  • Leading the OPS Specialist team and guiding them towards results

  • Make a diagnosis and generate insights with its corresponding action plan

  • Identify customer needs and align them with the Product team

  • Define strategies and identify customer growth opportunities in On-going/Adoption stages

Your experience has been shaped by:

  • Project management and leadership experience at least 5 years

  • At least 3 year as a team leader

  • Native spanish and English

  • A fast paced environment

results.title: Customer Success Engineer
results.description:
**We only consider candidates from Singapore for this role**
 
Accelerating the Web3 transformation journey

Blockchain application development is hard.

Fewer than 1% of developers have experience with this technology but it is increasingly clear that everyone on the planet will be positively impacted in the coming years by blockchain, as meaningful applications are built and adoption increases.

SettleMint is here to make blockchain application development easy for developers, by providing the best high-performance low-code platform for blockchain development for enterprises and the public sector.

We abstract away complexity so developers can devote their time and efforts to building game-changing solutions for a better tomorrow.

 

We are a venture-funded global scale-up, and we recently closed our series-A funding of €16 million, co-led by Molten Ventures and OTB Ventures. We reached a new phase of growth, and we are now going to expand our operations and teams really fast, with clients in financial services, retail, manufacturing, and public institutions across the globe, and offices in Europe (Belgium), MEA (Dubai), India (Delhi), and APAC (Singapore). We work closely with our growing network of partners in all regions enabling them to quickly deliver solutions to their clients.

 

We are a remote-first company, we work async and we empower our team members to take ownership of their work.
We hire the best talents in the blockchain space and we trust their ability to do a great 100%!

Skills, values alignment, and cultural fit are equally important to us, as they will enable top-performing team members to rapidly grow their careers with us.

If this sounds exciting to you, go ahead and apply for this role!

 

The role

As the Customer Success Engineer, you work directly with customers, mainly the IT departments of our integration partners, to make sure they get the most value out of our product and receive all the service they need to achieve their goals.

 

You focus on delivering exceptional experiences to our customers by setting them up for success and driving adoption and engagement across the entire post-sale journey.

 

You are the biggest cheerleader of the company, actively engaging with our customers and cultivating customer championship through every step of their journey. You make sure they experience the value of our company and product from the moment you onboard them through their full life cycle. You are also the voice of the customer and are responsible for communicating customer feedback and needs to the other teams in the company.

You become an integral part of an international team, working remotely. You will be in the Customer Success team, which is a cross-functional group of customer success managers, DevRels, support engineers, and technical content creators. All closely working together on creating trusted relationships with all customer stakeholders to ensure they receive a world-class service. You report directly to the VP of Customer Success.

Responsibilities

  • Onboard new customers, educate and train them on how to use our product

  • Provide product guidance, implementation assistance, and troubleshooting

  • Guide customers through all the tools and content available to support them in their journey

  • Provide professional services and solution consulting to make sure customers are successful in the delivery of their projects.

  • Increase customer lifetime value through higher product adoption and customer happiness

  • Continuously monitor the health and happiness of our customers

What we are looking for

  • 3 years experience in working across the post-sales experience from onboarding, training, implementation, project management, and support

  • A service mindset with a passion for working with technical customers

  • Ability to speak to technical customers in their language

  • Knowledge and big love for blockchain. Active working experience in a blockchain or SaaS company in an enterprise context is a plus.

  • Great communication skills and fluent in English

Benefits of working at SettleMint

  • Be part of the Blockchain / WEB3 revolution
  • Dynamic but stable scale-up, with the mission to make blockchain accessible for all
  • A fun team to be in, with high standards and a culture of transparency and collaboration
  • Attractive salary package
  • Commission based on performance
  • Flexible working hours, location, and async work environment
  • Generous Paid Time Off
  • Clear targets and clear rewards when you crush them
  • Global colleagues who are passionate, hardworking and smart, just like you!
  • Constant training and coaching on both Blockchain Technology and Sales
  • A fast-growing team that is fired up and passionate about what we do because, well, it is bloody important
  • We care about your growth and development and promote lateral and vertical career progression

 

Inclusivity and belonging.

SettleMint is inclusive for everyone, and is for anyone.

We encourage candidates from all ethnic, gender, sexual, age, and abilities groups to apply and be part of our company.

We are a very diverse team, and we want to continue our efforts in hiring and retaining the most diverse talents from all over the world.

SettleMint is a remote-first company, with our work culture and company policies centered around remote work. Operating from various locations around the globe, with offices in Leuven (Europe), Dubai (UEA/MEA), Singapore (APAC), Tokyo and Delhi (India), employees are linked to their nearest regional office but are empowered to work remotely, in the office or anything in-between that they find most comfortable.

We believe in offering employees a flexible workspace to create a happy, productive, diverse and inclusive team.

results.title: District Customer Success Manager
results.description:
Company Description

Company Overview:
At Nearpod, we believe teaching is the most important job in the world. Every day, we reach students through our learning platforms on Nearpod.com and Flocabulary.com. We have diverse backgrounds, but a shared goal of putting teachers and students first in everything that we do. We have won numerous awards including EdTech Digest’s 2018 Company of the Year. Recently, we were acquired by Renaissance to support the shared mission of accelerating learning for all. We’re looking for people with a lot of hustle, a lot of empathy, and a desire to do something meaningful. We've adopted a remote-first culture, and our diverse team is based across the US.


Territory: Various, Eastern Standard time zone preferred


Location: Remote (travel < 10%)



Job Description

Position Overview:

We believe that Customer Success is all about understanding your customers’ desired outcomes and working with them to ensure they experience the most value possible along the way. As a Customer Success Manager (CSM) at Nearpod, you are a part of the teacher and administrator journey through onboarding, nurturing, and renewal. The goal is to not only retain your customers, but to ensure that they have an exceptional experience with our platform that drives successful student learning outcomes. This role manages school or district level accounts. We are looking for you to be an expert multi-tasker to drive successful implementations at scale and manage customer relationships with quality. 

 Location: Remote

Territory: Illinois

Our Ideal Candidate

  • Drive adoption, retention, and expansion for our valuable customers by understanding their needs, defining success criteria, and crafting success plans to help them achieve their goals
  • Create strategies to maximize renewals for the customers entrusted to your care (gross retention)
  • Develop a communication cadence with customers and  monitor account health to deliver on student learning outcomes
  • Anticipate customer need in accordance with closely monitored metrics; adapts strategic plans in order to achieve mutually beneficial long-term objectives and goals
  • Continuously self-educate about Nearpod’s products and solutions and the K-12 competitive landscape
  • Manage relationships with administrators and teachers using Nearpod and/or Flocabulary to guarantee that they are achieving their desired outcomes
  • Strategize with sales, marketing and product teams throughout the onboarding, nurturing and renewal Customer Success journey 
  • Manage expansion sales process through qualification, needs analysis, product demonstration, negotiation and close sale or work with your sales counterpart in collaboration
  • Overcome customer objections by demonstrating negotiation skills and ability to sell benefits not features
  • Actively seeks to understand change and incorporate new processes and systems quickly and effectively 
  • Participate in internal departmental committees to assist in process improvement, resource creation or other priorities assigned by committee leads if assigned 
  • Mentor new Customer Success Managers and assists in new employee onboarding training and development if assigned


Qualifications

Required Skills & Experience

  • You have ~1-3 years of education background preferred (classroom, tech coach, school admin) and/or  CSM/education implementation/vendor role experience
  • You are able to operate in a highly efficient manner by balancing a high volume of inbound requests with proactive outbound activities
  • You have strong technical skills; you like learning new software and techniques
  • You convey complicated information in written and verbal communication that is simple, clear, concise, professional, and friendly
  • You are driven to exceed customer expectations
  • You’ve worked in a company doing Customer Success or similar customer-facing role
  • You have a background in Education and/or with SaaS companies
  • You have the ability to travel


Additional Information

Employment Requirements: Must be authorized to work in the U.S. without restrictions.

 

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

results.title: Enterprise Technical Success Manager
results.description:
We are looking for an experienced individual to join our Customer Success organization where you will be responsible for the success and long-term growth of our most valued customers across the Enterprise growth segment. In this role, you will be the key point of contact for our customers, helping to improve the value they receive from our solutions and cultivating a successful long-term partnership.

The Technical Success Manager role is a perfect role for someone who has strong technical proficiency, loves partnering with customers, and has a solid Enterprise CS foundation. They'll own a diverse book of customers ranging in industries and deployment types with strategic, focused efforts on developing a deep understanding of your customers’ unique business challenges and ensuring their investment in our products are providing significant business impact for them.

About Customer Success at CircleCI

The Customer Success Team at CircleCI plays a pivotal role with our customers. The team is responsible for ensuring customers are appreciating maximum value from our platform, and identifying ways we can help a customer solve business problems. You'll cultivate and grow a portfolio of new and existing clients and act as a trusted advisor and ambassador for CircleCI.

In terms of growth, we truly believe in the continued development of each new hire. In joining this team, you’ll take part in a community that believes in development and promotion from within and as a rapidly growing business, there are a lot of opportunities for progression.

What you’ll do:
  • Own an assigned book of accounts with a focus on onboarding, driving product usage, growing engagement and ensuring retention
  • Educate customers on new and existing features, strategizing on how to optimize their use of the product and services to drive significant business value
  • Identify both business and technical use cases and partner with the customer to build a mutual success plan to help accomplish those objectives
  • Lead executive business reviews with customers by presenting usage data, performance metrics, business outcomes, and recommendations
  • Partner with Account Executives to identify expansion opportunities within your portfolio
  • Be the voice of the customer as you partner with engineering, marketing, product, and sales to deliver outstanding customer experience
  • Partner with DevOps customer engineers to ensure technical success
  • Forecast and monitor platform usage to identify potential risk and areas of opportunity
What we're looking for:
  • You can tie business problems to technical solutions and understand technology value propositions
  • Proven track record of being an agent of change within your book of business
  • Deep experience crafting and implementing strategic account plans
  • Outstanding written and oral communication skills
  • 5+ years B2B SaaS customer success, or account management or consulting experience in a customer facing role
  • A strong technical foundation, preferably in CI/CD or the software delivery lifecycle
  • Git and GitHub knowledge required
  • Previous experience with usage driven pricing models

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

About CircleCI

CircleCI is the world’s largest shared continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the hub where code moves from idea to delivery. As one of the most-used DevOps tools - processing more than 1 million builds a day - CircleCI has unique access to data on how engineering teams work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, and BuzzFeed use us to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster.

Founded in 2011 and headquartered in downtown San Francisco with a global, remote workforce, CircleCI is venture-backed by Base10, Greenspring Associates, Eleven Prime, IVP, Sapphire Ventures, Top Tier Capital Partners, Baseline Ventures, Threshold Ventures, Scale Venture Partners, Owl Rock Capital, Next Equity Partners, Heavybit and Harrison Metal Capital.

CircleCI is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

Salary Range: $110,000 - $130,000

results.title: Student Success Manager
results.description:
DESCRIPTION

Fullstack Academy is the premier technology skills accelerator providing immersive, intensive, rapid courses (e.g. bootcamps) that bridge the skills gap between our students and employer partners. Fullstack Academy operates Fullstack-branded bootcamps in New York and nationally through University partners. Offering curricula in Web Development, Cybersecurity and other in-demand technologies, Fullstack Academy’s three- to six-month bootcamps have changed the lives of thousands of students and re-defined where employers are finding top talent.

ABOUT THE ROLE

As a Student Success Manager at Fullstack Academy, you will own the day-to-day activities and operations of classes at Fullstack Academy boot camps. This position will manage operations for technology courses, engaging with students and instructional staff to ensure an exceptional student experience.

This role is full-time and remote. Please note the ability to flex hours and work “second shift” is critical to support the classes and will be an expectation of the person in this role.

There are 2 shift positions available. You can be based in any time zone, but will be responsible for working during the hours below, depending on the position chosen:

  • Position 1: 9am-5pm PST
  • Position 2: 12pm-8pm PST (Fridays will be on an earlier schedule)

RESPONSIBILITIES
In this role, you will:

  • Serve as the initial primary point of contact for students between enrollment and cohort start
  • Conduct outreach to newly enrolled students to onboard them into class
  • Oversee day-to-day operations of several cohorts, to ensure we are delivering on our brand promise of an exceptional learning experience, including but not limited to:
    • Communicating with students who have unexcused absences
    • Withdrawing students from class
    • Creating rotating learning teams
    • Reviewing assessment scores to make sure we are catching any students falling behind
  • Resolve student issues (e.g. behavioral, academic, accommodations) and connect with Instructors, Mentors, and Program Manager, as needed.
  • Assist in coordinating study sessions and crafting student/program issue solutions
  • Attend live cohorts twice a week as well as support guided practice sessions
  • Collaborate with instructional, career services, and other functional staff to ensure course delivery run smoothly
  • Plan and lead community-building initiatives
  • Assist in the design, testing, and implementation of student retention initiatives (e.g. tech panels, guided review sessions etc.)
  • Hold group coaching sessions with students to help them succeed through our courses, providing guidance on areas including time management, study habits, emotional support, and overcoming challenges students face in and out of the classroom
  • Document all interactions in the appropriate institutional systems
  • Review key course metrics on a regular basis, you will need to coordinate with the team on how to improve on feedback, as well as escalate larger issues to the program manager
    • Student Experience (Satisfaction Surveys)
    • Student Engagement
    • Graduation Rate
  • Contribute to relevant projects in areas such as documentation, data collection, and process improvement
  • Support the Career Success and Employer Relations team to deliver outstanding career outcomes to students, including coordinating class speakers and reviewing resumes, cover letters, etc.
  • Complete other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS

We think you are a great candidate if you have:

  • 3+ years of experience directly managing programs (in high-touch customer-facing roles) in fast-paced higher education, startup, and/or technology industries
  • Great attention to detail and project management skills
  • High empathy and excellent interpersonal and conflict-resolution skills
  • Worked in a role where motivating others was essential to your success
  • A track record of delivering outstanding customer/student satisfaction
  • The ability to operate and execute independently, while collaborating with internal teams and leadership to get the support you need to drive success
  • Comfort operating in ambiguity and providing structure to blue-sky thoughts
  • Passion for creating positive outcomes in people’s lives through education
  • Experience working with and supporting diverse, underrepresented and/or low-income populations

We think you will be an exceptional candidate if you also have:

  • Deep experience working with adult students within an educational setting
  • Experience in the coding boot camp, higher ed, or OPM industry
  • Talent in community building and experience doing so in a remote environment

Colorado and New York Equal Pay For Equal Work Act disclosure:

The expected compensation for this role for candidates from Colorado and New York is $54,000-68,000 annually, plus benefits, for candidates who fulfill the qualifications for the role. Candidates whose qualifications are above those listed are encouraged to apply as well. All final offers to candidates will be based on that candidate's unique experience and skillset, and not all candidates will qualify for the top of the salary range.

results.title: Customer Support Specialist
results.description:
About Mangomint

At Mangomint, we’re building next-generation software that’s optimizing how salons and spas manage their business. Our platform is used daily by thousands of salon and spa professionals in the U.S. and Canada to handle everything from appointment booking, staff management, payment processing, and so much more.

Backed by one of the leading product-led growth VCs, you can be sure the opportunity to work at Mangomint is one filled with possibilities.

We’re still a pretty small team but we’re doing really BIG things. We’re currently working remotely with the occasional meetup every few months. Overall, we’re a fun, accepting, and hard-working group of people that care a lot about bringing in other amazing people as we grow!


About the Role

At Mangomint, our customers are everything. Because of that, we have the standard of providing no less than top-tier customer support to our clients. When our clients have questions, they need quick and accurate answers, and our Customer Support Specialists provide just that. Our customers have high expectations of us and we have high expectations of our Customer Service Specialists. Some of the things you can expect in this role are:

  • Responding to customer support messages from our customers primarily through chat but also over a phone call at times
  • Continually increasing your Mangomint product knowledge so you can provide expert-level answers and service
  • Being available on some evenings and weekends (This person will cover support on the weekend every 3 weeks. Please be sure this is something you’d be comfortable with before applying.)

Requirements

What We're Looking For

As previously mentioned, we have high expectations for our Customer Support Specialists. To help you better know if this role is something you could be a fit for, here are some of the things we’re looking for:

  • You live in the Central or Eastern Standard Time zone (CST or EST)
  • You have a minimum of 1 year of experience in a software support position
  • You have an ability to learn incredibly quickly and an “I’ll figure it out” attitude while also not being afraid to ask questions
  • You’re independent and have the ability to work well autonomously and with a team
  • You enjoy working on difficult-to-solve problems, even if it’s in a stressful situation at times

Benefits

What You'll Love about Mangomint

  • Health, dental and vision insurance
  • Lots of opportunities for career and personal growth
  • Remote work
  • Competitive compensation
  • Supportive environment with fun and respectful culture
  • 401k (no matching…yet)



Mangomint is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity), national origin, age, disibility and genetic information (including family medical history).

results.title: Client Executive
results.description:
Would you like to be part of a growing national healthcare solutions company? Are you looking to positively affect thousands of lives each day via health benefits?

We are hiring for a Client Executive to join our team.

Who we are

Allied is a national healthcare solutions company that supports healthy workplace cultures.

What we do

We are problem-solvers, innovators, and collaborators. Our purpose is to work with employers to take care of their employees and their families every day – and it all starts with the Allied family. 

What’s in it for you?

Allied supports an inclusive culture focused on developing employees to succeed, innovate & impact the community.

Here’s how we do it

Training and Development: Allied offers tailored learning and development curriculums for all employees and a Learning Management Database with thousands of courses for professional and personal development.

Career Mobility: Growth opportunities are endless at Allied. In 2021 alone, one in five employees had a job change. 75% of these job changes were promotions!

Employee Engagement: We pride ourselves on employee engagement! With our recognition program, employees recognize their colleagues monthly or donate to charities with cash rewards. Allied has a dedicated committee planning monthly engagement activities to create endless opportunities to get to know your peers and destress in this new remote world.

Employee Feedback: We regularly survey our employees throughout the year to seek continuous feedback, ideas and suggestions on new initiatives.

Community Outreach: We have dedicated committees focused on fundraising efforts supporting our employees and their families, furthering education goals and providing funds for charitable organizations outside of Allied.

What will you be doing?

The Client Executive candidate is a goal oriented, driven, team player with a willingness and desire to sell new business. This position will be focused on renewal business and client management for the ASO block of business.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

  • Communication
  • Cost Awareness/Budgeting

  • Service Focus
  • Initiative

SKILLS & ABILITIES

  • Intermediate proficiency with Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint.
  • Excellent interpersonal, sales, and customer service skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.

Experience

  • At least 10 years of progressive and successful sales experience in health benefits required.

Education:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience required

Certificates & Licenses

Producer's license preferred.

Computer work, long periods of sitting

Work Environment
Remote

results.title: Customer Success Manager
results.description:
Hurdle is a Chronomics brand inc.

We are looking for someone based in UK 🇬🇧, but the role is remote first 🏠


Engineering is at the heart of what we do at Chronomics and our API first approach drives everything. We are using technology to disrupt science and empower people with their health data.


🧬 Who we are:
At Hurdle, we are building a bio-infrastructure platform to power the use of biomarkers in everyday life. We are on a mission to “make the unseen actionable”.
We reduce the cost, time and complexity of bio-science by automating logistic, sample collection and presentation of results through our seamless API-driven solution.

We power diagnostics for tele-health, create scientific diet plans, transform how people sleep, customize skincare routines, track the biological impact of fitness programs - all so innovators in every industry can add value to their users.

We are a remote-first company with hubs in London 🇬🇧 and New York 🇺🇸, and employees working from various places in the UK 🇬🇧, Ireland 🇮🇪, Spain 🇪🇸, Germany 🇩🇪, Serbia 🇷🇸, the US 🇺🇸 and Canada 🇨🇦.
Founded by scientists from the world’s leading research universities, we have brought together an expert team across science, technology, business and operations.

We’re growing rapidly and sustainably with revenue outpacing all projections (without the need to raise money externally) and we’re trusted by industry leaders like Superdrug, and Tui… though we’re not stopping here.

Our vision is for biology data and insight to be accessible for everyone. We are at the dawn of a ‘bio revolution’ and to make that happen, we’re creating original and innovative products that allow access to biology at the software level.


🧩Where you will make a difference
Although it’s commonly referred to (and we’ve advertised it) as Customer Success, we at Hurdle prefer to call it: Partner Success.
Our Partner Success team is responsible for the entire lifecycle of our clients. We rely on our Partner Success team to ensure clients are given great service with the utmost trust and diligence and ensure that their experience of using our products exceeds their expectations.Partner Success Managers are “Trusted Advisors”; bringing thought leadership to our partners and advocating our products. This is an exciting opportunity that allows you to combine technical knowledge with account / client management. You will join a small team of two and look after our partners, guiding them through their product requirements from scope to launch, building lasting relationships and making the most of opportunities to expand our partners product ranges.
If you appreciate enabling Customers to build the best user experiences and products and are excited to play your part in our story, as we expand our platforms globally, we want to hear from you.

Requirements

✔️As a Partner Success Manager you will:

  • Own relationship with portfolio of assigned partners, work with them to shape bold product adoption paths that maximize value creation and delight
  • Design joint solutions with assigned partners, identifying best ways to embed our products into our partners’ offerings and deliver impactful vertical solutions
  • Deliver partner deployment projects, orchestrating activities across functional teams incl. commercial, operations, product, engineering and science
  • Own and lead ARR retention and expansion with assigned partners
  • Finally, you may also get the opportunity to Identify product and operational improvement opportunities based on learnings from partner deployments, and collaborate with cross-functional colleagues towards implementation

🚀 You will be set up for success if you have:

  • 3-5 years experience in a similar role
  • Experience in running launch initiatives with multiple stakeholders and uniting everyone around a common purpose, plan and deadline.
  • Experience in account management, relationship building and long-term partnership building
  • Experience in owning ARR renewal and commercial expansion
  • High level technical/product understanding around API endpoints, platforms and infrastructure
  • Comfortable with data analytics and data platforms (i.e. Metabase, BI) as a way to analyse issues and make informed decisions.

☄️What would make you amazing (nice to haves):

  • In depth technical product understanding around API, platforms and infrastructure
  • Health tech / Biotech industry knowledge

😊 Ideal behaviours:

  • Great communicator
  • Problem Solving
  • Analytical Thinking
  • Team player
  • Proactive mindset

Benefits

What you can expect from us:

  • 🛬 Unlimited holidays (20 days minimum)
  • 🏃 Fully remote work with freedom to run
  • 💻 A remote-working budget to help you set up your home office
  • 💪🏻 Private health insurance
  • 📝 Pension
  • 📍 Access Global Coworking Space
  • 🥳 Global Meetups
  • 🎓 Annual Learning and Development Budget
  • 📈 Meaningful equity in the company
  • 💰 Competitive salary + Performance and Revenue related bonus

Be your authentic self at work

As we go global, we want our team to reflect the diverse and multicultural world we live in.

So, we choose to talk about Inclusion and Diversity [in that specific order] because we believe Diversity won’t be successful without Inclusion first. We build teams, cultivate leaders and create a company that’s the right fit for every person in it.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Please note, we don't accept applications from recruitment agencies - thank you!

If you’re interested in learning more about what we do and how you could join the team, please submit your application. We appreciate experience comes in different forms and you don't always need to check every box.

results.title: Community Experience Director
results.description:
Community Experience- Community Experience Director

Full Time, Remote

Prenda is on a mission to empower learners. We help people run microschools, where small groups of kids meet, often in a home, and own their education. The model is helping light a fire for kids like Mo (https://youtu.be/g4nLjauGM3U), and we want to empower many more. Imagine a world where kids grow up as empowered learners - they choose to learn, develop their gifts, and apply their passion and grit to solve the world’s big problems!

We are looking for a Community Experience Director. This is a new role for Prenda. We tried the traditional marketing route of digital ads and sales funnels and they didn’t work. Prenda started with a community-first approach, and we’re going to reinvest deeply into community again, going back to our roots. We have been working with a community consultant (David Spinks) to design our community strategy from the ground up.

This role reports directly to the Chief Growth Officer with full visibility with the entire executive team, including the CEO/Founder Kelly Smith. You will be a part of taking our vision and making it happen through community experiments, learning, and developing roles within the community. You are someone who has successfully inspired and has been a part of building engaging communities. You understand how to build community with Prenda’s goals in mind to resolve complex issues, improve processes and find new solutions. You are regarded as an expert in your field and have strong interpersonal skills allowing you to work with internal teams and community leaders. You also understand how to translate a strategy into action and lead a team to the successful execution of the plan.

Our company is obsessed with the mission of empowering learners, we live our core values of Start with Heart, Foundation of Trust, Dare Greatly, Figure It Out, and Learning Over Comfort. We see the hearts and minds of humans as the single most important resource on Earth. All of us have unlimited capacity to solve problems, reason, inspire, create, fail, iterate, and grow. We want our community to help people understand how to help kids be active learners, leading their educational journey and teaching parents how to support them.

Prenda is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We base our employment decisions on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on these characteristics, and we encourage applicants of all ages.

Responsibilities

  • Implement Prenda’s community strategy to onboard and activate community leaders (known as “Coaches”) who recruit and support the people who run our Microschools (known as “Guides”)
  • Work with internal teams on process and continued development of the community experience team
  • Oversee digital community spaces including Mighty Networks (for existing Guides) and PrendaCon (our in-person Prenda conference)
  • Manage a remote team of 5-7 people
  • Work collaboratively with the Media team on the development of content for the community

Education/Experience/Other Requirements

  • Directly supervised one or more community professionals in a previous role
  • Experience with the development, design, testing, documentation, and analysis of new community programs
  • Experience building community focused on achieving marketing goals is a plus
  • 4-6 years of related experience preferred
  • Startup experience a plus
  • Managing remote teams a plus
  • Ability to travel required
Benefits
  • Competitive salary combined with equity ($120-$130k approximate salary range)
  • Health insurance
  • Home office set up stipend
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Entirely remote team
  • Live and work by our core values of Start with Heart, Foundation of Trust, Dare Greatly, Figure It Out, and Learning Over Comfort.

results.title: Contact Center Consultant
results.description:
B2B tech company is seeking a Contact Center Consultant to join their team!

WHAT WE DO

At Cloud Revolution, our focus is inspired by our clients' complex communication challenges. We're advocates, champions, experts, and kindred spirits in the cloud platforms in which they architect their futures. We provide the expertise to streamline and accelerate our clients' reality of a robust cloud ecosystem, including advanced capabilities and specializations. And we're FastTrack-ready.

From its inception, Cloud Revolution has focused on this opportunity and gathered talent to offer these deep and unique Teams-centric capabilities to the market. And we've never looked back.

THE OPPORTUNITY
Cloud Revolution is seeking an organized, helpful, and passionate problem solver who enjoys understanding business challenges and solving them with technology. The right person for this role is naturally an excellent listener, enjoys inventing solutions to unique challenges, and at the same time can push projects and tasks to completion, works independently, and is eager to learn about a variety of Microsoft Teams certified contact center solutions such as Anywhere 365, 8x8, TalkDesk, and Genesys. 

The primary job focus is to implement contact center solutions for external clients and resolve associated issues with contact center performance. Experience implementing Microsoft Teams is a plus. While we already have a team of experienced consultants, we will be adding new vendors and so this role may need to help figure out how to deliver new technologies within an existing framework. 

We all work from home across the country. To be successful in this role, you will need to be able to stay motivated and engaged in a remote environment and be comfortable using video and voice calls, instant messaging, and email to stay connected. We try to get together in person at least once a year.

WHAT YOU WILL DO

  • Meet with customer to understand their challenges around contact center and the caller experience.
  • Understand and communicate reporting needs surrounding contact center performance.
  • Implement and configure a variety of contact center solutions such as Anywhere 365, 8x8, TalkDesk, and/or Genesys for external clients within budget and schedule constraints.
  • Regularly attend training courses and webinars to increase experience and knowledge surrounding contact center (may be remote or in person).
  • As time allows, build knowledge of Microsoft Teams voice solutions and participate in Microsoft Teams Voice project work. 
  • Document issue resolutions in a knowledge base and regularly share that knowledge with the rest of the team.
  • Participate in rotating on-call schedule.
  • As time allows, work on specific project tasks as assigned by the team lead.
  • Travel to company events up to a couple times a year and to client sites as needed. Anticipated travel is up to 10% within the United States.

WHAT YOU WILL BRING TO OUR ORGANIZATION 

  • 3+ years' experience with basic networking, routing, and switching, Active Directory, Contact Center, or Microsoft Teams combined with a natural understanding of how to troubleshoot a problem. 
  • 3+ years' experience working as a contact center agent or supervisor, executive assistant, or other role that makes heavy use of advanced phone features. Able to explain the different types of transfers, what call park is, and features such as barge and whisper, callback, reason codes, etc. 
  • 3+ years' experience working with external customers, partners, and vendors.
  • Open and professional communication skills are required; you'll be working with world-class project managers and clients.
  • Excellent business English skills, with ability to talk competently and professionally with vendors, end users, and technical SMEs.
  • Desire and willingness to take certification coursework. Some may be required, others you may want to pursue with our support.
  • Understanding the importance of accepting and contributing feedback in order to grow as a team and individual.
  • Growth mindset and capability to learn quickly and independently. 

The successful candidate:

  • Enjoys operating with humans at the center, and therefore naturally possesses excellent customer service and hospitality skills.
  • Has a passion for listening to business challenges and solving them with technology.
  • Enjoys learning new technologies and building best practices around their implementation.
  • Is a Self-Starter who loves to figure things out and can balance that desire with excellent judgement as to when to ask for help or admit a mistake.
  • Having experience with a business intelligence reporting tool such as PowerBI, QlikView, or Tableau is a plus. 
  • Having experience in a business analysis role is a plus.

WHAT OUR ORGANIZATION IS PROVIDING

  • Expected annual salary range of $90,000 - $115,000
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance
  • 401(k)
  • Paid time off starting at 15 days annually 
  • 48 hours of sick time off annually.
  • 10+ paid holidays.

In addition to federal law requirements, Cloud Revolution complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

results.title: Community Manager (Chinese)
results.description:
The role is based in the GMT+8 Timezone. We can engage you in Singapore, China or remotely if applicable.

About Us

DeGate is limit orders, decentralised. 

We are an order book-centric Decentralised Exchange (DEX) trading protocol that is secured by Ethereum, utilising a Decentralised Autonomous Organisation (DAO) structure that has full control over its treasury. As a next-gen DEX, DeGate aims to make decentralised exchange trading mainstream and accessible to all, with key features such as Order Book Trading, Leverage Capabilities, and Super-fast Transaction Times amongst others.

 

 

We Want You

We are looking for individuals who are keen to join our group of talented project contributors. You are someone who: 

  • has an immense interest in blockchain-related technology
  • well on your way to being a Crypto-Native 
  • has an insatiable thirst for growth and learning, 
  • is keen to build and grow together with the industry

 

What you'll be doing
  • Actively manage all manner of activities in relation to the Chinese blockchain community.
  • Drive community engagement, evangelize and represent DeGate brand and product to a fast-growing global blockchain community across a variety of local and international social media platforms.
  • Actively manage communication and conversations from various social media channels.
  • Build and nurture relationships with ecosystem stakeholders in the Ethereum community.
  • Assist with the education and onboarding of partners, designing incentive programs, and ensuring a successful partnership.
  • Inspire growth, excitement, and education about our product within the ecosystem.

 

What you'll need
  • 2+ years of working experience (internship counts).
  • Native Mandarin (due to the requirement to interact with the Chinese community) and professional English Fluency.
  • Good interest in Cryptocurrency and Blockchain technology, preferably someone who is a Crypto Native user.
  • Have participated in various community groups within the industry.
  • Excellent communicator, able to distil complex topics and processes in a clear and concise manner.
  • Ability to take initiative and work independently.
  • Excellent organizational skills. Technical background is a plus.

 

Bounty Scheme

If you have a candidate to refer to us, or is an agency with suitable candidates, you can consider the applicable Bounty Programmes, promising good rewards for your effort.

results.title: Customer Success Manager - Digital Identity & Authentication
results.description:
Incognia is a privacy-first location identity company providing trust and safety solutions for location-centric apps including marketplaces, gaming operators, banks and fintechs, for increased revenues and lower fraud losses. Incognia’s award-winning technology uses location signals and motion sensors to silently recognize trusted users based on their unique behavior patterns and is a key enabler for zero-factor authentication. Deployed in over 200 million devices, Incognia delivers a highly precise and predictive risk signal with extremely low false-positive rates.

 

Incognia is privately held and headquartered in Palo Alto, California with teams in New York, and São Paulo and Recife, Brazil.

 

Our values:

  • We don't want to know the real world identities of our users

  • Our priority is to serve our customers

  • We are fast problem solvers

  • We respect each other and are free to be ourselves

  • We work as a team to win together

  • We seek what is best for our future

 

 

The team:

The Customer Success team is a multidisciplinary team, we work on the border between the technical (fraud and technology) and business (relationship, processes, upsell) worlds. We play a central role in the operation, helping to coordinate internal teams in order to resolve all customer-related issues. Therefore, we also exercise an internal leadership role, which requires maturity and negotiation skills. Finally, we have a very strong partnership with the sales team and the team responsible for integrations to ensure customer success at all stages of the process.

 

 

The opportunity:

The role of Customer Success for Digital Identity & Authentication is to ensure that the customer is getting the most value possible from our solution, ensuring that the client is achieving/exceeding expected results. We monitor usage metrics, suggest and coordinate the implementation of improvements, resolve technical issues and support the commercial team in upsell/cross sell opportunities.

 

Primary responsibilities:

  • Engage customers in strategy meetings to derive maximum value from their partnership with Incognia;

  • Build and foster relationships with key decision makers and stakeholders across multiple customers.

  • Manage a portfolio of Incognia accounts to combat diverse fraud types;

    • Monitor usage and performance metrics;

    • Propose improvements in customer processes, based on our solutions;

    • Monitor the resolution of internal improvements that impact the customer;

    • Follow customer roadmap activities related to our solutions;

  • Manage the relationship with the main customer stakeholders;

    • Periodic meetings with the client for accountability and follow-up;

  • Contribute to the maturation of the team/company processes Improvement of internal processes to optimize the scalability of our operations;

    • Participate in industry events (SaaS, authentication, anti-fraud and digital identity) in order to expand networking and continue to enhance industry knowledge.

  • Bachelor’s degree in business or technology fields;

  • 2+ years of experience with authentication, biometrics, anti-fraud, digital or mobile identity solutions;

  • SaaS B2B experience;

  • Previous experience managing medium/large accounts;

  • Experience with data analysis and SQL - ability to work data in different tables/databases;

  • Definition and analysis of KPIs;

 

Salary and benefits

  • Annual Salary - USD 100k - 150k + Bonus
  • Medical, dental, vision and life insurance
  • Remote work stipend - $100/month
  • 401(K)
  • 22 business days PTO per year
  • Paid sick leave
  • Employee Stock Options Program (ESOP)

 

 

 

Recruitment process:

  • People interview

  • Manager interview

  • Technical Case

  • Technical Case presentation

  • Cultural fit with CEO

results.title: Customer Success Associate
results.description:
Gencove combines low-pass whole genome sequencing with a proprietary software-as-a-service computation layer. The result is a unique, high-volume, cost-effective sequencing platform. We believe that the universal application of genomics across human, animal, plant, and microbial applications will lead to a healthier and more sustainable civilization. We recently closed Series A funding, are revenue-generating and some of the largest genomics service providers in the world partner with Gencove.

As a Customer Success Associate, you will work closely with Customer Success Managers to help manage Gencove’s growing global customer base. You will be a high-impact contributor working in a fast-paced environment, connecting with our existing clients, while supporting new business needs.

Requirements

What You Will Work On

  • Manage day to day operations of customer facing projects including: drafting SOWs with 3rd party partners, monitoring timelines to ensure on-time delivery of work and partnering closely with customer success and sales teams to manage customer expectations.
  • Support client meetings by gathering inputs and compiling data, building presentation decks and assisting with follow up actions
  • Manage and resolve customer questions quickly and effectively via Zendesk
  • Report and escalate issues to necessary internal teams
  • Suggest improvements to training materials and knowledge base when undocumented issues arise
  • Identify systematic issues based on your experience working directly with partners or clients and bring to appropriate cross-functional teams to identify and solve with process improvements

Who You Are:

  • You have 2+ years of customer success or account management experience
  • You are deeply detail oriented and keep a close eye on the fine print
  • You can learn complex technical specifications and requirements and speak eloquently about them.
  • You have an ability to break down ambiguous problems into concrete, manageable components and think through solutions.
  • You are a strong partner and can collaborate with technical teams to drive effective problem resolution.
  • You are an effective communicator and can influence credibly and effectively at all levels
  • While a background in the life sciences is a bonus, it is not a requirement for this role

Benefits

Why Gencove:

  • We are a fast growing team and the product and the company’s needs will change, so your role will also evolve with time — with a sharp eye towards your professional development and personal satisfaction.
  • We are a fully distributed company driven by deliverables, not hours, operating with a foundation of trust and clear communication to solve meaningful scientific and business challenges.
  • We celebrate individuality and invest in bringing everyone together regularly at our HQ in NYC because we believe there is no substitute for real-life connection.
  • Competitive salary and stock options.
  • Flexible PTO plus the days between Christmas and New Year’s Day are company-wide time off; we actually do take time to disconnect, recharge, travel, and live our lives so we encourage you to do the same!
  • 3 months paid parental leave with flexibility to allocate however works best for you.
  • Comprehensive health coverage (medical, dental, vision and life) for you and your family.
  • $1,000 USD home office stipend to upgrade or enhance your work from home setup.

results.title: Customer Care Assistant
results.description:
ABOUT US

MATCHESFASHION started with a single shop in Wimbledon more than 30 years ago and has grown into one of the biggest global destinations in online luxury for men and women, carrying a modern edit of 650+ established and new-generation designers, delivering to over 176 countries. With offices in the UK and Hong Kong, our aspiration is to be the most personal luxury shopping site in the world. In London, our head office is based in The Shard, while our creative hub is in Here East, and 5 Carlos Place, a recently updated retail concept combining digital and physical elements, is based in Mayfair.

 

OUR COMMITMENT TO DEI

We want to attract the very best talent and create an inclusive environment that celebrates the diversity of our people and enables them to do their best work. We recognise the world is not a perfect place and that bias exists, which is why we are committed to ensuring that all our people processes are equitable.

 

THE CUSTOMER CARE TEAM

Customer Care is a dynamic team of talented, customer-focused, resourceful, problem-solving individuals, and we are passionate about all things related to our customers’ experience. Our team is highly collaborative, with our finger on the pulse – ready to solve any problem. In this role not only will you have the pleasure of assisting our customers, you will constantly be learning and find yourself gaining exposure to other facets of the business. We champion our people and provide a dynamic, diverse and supportive workplace. We are a team built on a nonhierarchical environment with great people from diverse backgrounds. Our team embodies the can-do spirit – as well as always innovating, we are continuously driving forward MATCHESFASHION values.

 

 

ROLE: You probably know how this story goes…

A customer calls. Her name is Alison, she is calling from New York about an issue with her MATCHESFASHION order. In her previous experience with other brands these phone calls are time-consuming and unhelpful, so she is already preparing herself for an irritating conversation. Except that Customer Care means something different at MATCHESFASHION and it’s YOU that picked up her call. You are curious and keen to find out how you can help her, and you have the expertise to solve her problem (expertise which we help you refine with our comprehensive training as well as learning & development opportunities). You are polite and proactive; in the end she lowers her guard and opens up. Her order is something she needs for an event that may change her career. Whilst you find out what has happened with her order you realise you share a common interest in art galleries and travel, she suggests her favorite rooftop bar for you to visit if you are ever in New York. In the meantime, you have solved the problem. She is so grateful; you made her day! You wish her luck and close the call.

And just like that you have shown her that luxury at MATCHESFASHION is more than the content of the parcel she will receive soon (thanks to you!). It is in the expertise, generosity of spirit and in the connection created by its people.

Since our first MATCHESFASHION shop in Wimbledon over 30 years ago, providing a meaningful and personal luxury experience for our customers has been at the heart of what we do. Now are one of the biggest global destinations in online luxury for men and women, with a modern edit of over 450 established and new generation designers, delivering to over 176 countries. Famous for our fashion point of view, with a forward-looking focus on innovation and emerging talent, what remains the same as we grow is our focus on customers experience.

Everyday our Customer Care team connect and support our customers via phone, email, chat and social working collaboratively across the business and team to solve problems, help customers to place orders, making the right decisions and taking accountability for every single customers MATCHESFASHION journey. As our business grows so does our team. We are looking for people like you to come and help us create these experiences for each one of our customers every day. We like to consider ourselves a “one stop shop”. When you’re the person that our lucky customer connects with, you’ll be able to give them a concierge style service whatever their enquiry.

If you have experience in fast paced customer facing environments, are eager to learn and in search of an opportunity to distinguish yourself for your outstanding customer care talent in a leading luxury shopping destination you have come to the right place.

 

ABOUT YOU:

  • Love to solve a problem and take responsibility
  • Are resilient with the tenacity to not give up until the problem is solved
  • Have experience fast paced customer facing environments
  • Enjoy getting stuck in and working with your team and with business partners to find the right solution
  • Have fluent English both written and spoken
  • Know your way around Microsoft Office
  • Are able to work flexible shift patterns including evenings, weekends and bank holidays
  • Are keen to learn more about the luxury fashion industry and the exciting brands that we stock on MATCHESFASHION
  • This role is remote working and not office based.

 

BENEFITS

  • 50% employee discount
  • Hybrid working, with option to work across three locations – The Shard, Here East and Carlos Place (role dependent)
  • Breakfast provided at The Shard and Here East locations
  • 33 days holiday (including bank holidays), and the option to buy up to 5 additional days
  • Extra day off for your birthday
  • Access to Health Cash Plan including dental, glasses and contact lenses, physiotherapy and more.

Please Note: This role is fully remote, and we are open to candidates based all over the UK. This role is full time (37.5 hours) however part time hours are available. Shifts will be issued on a rota basis and consist of evenings and weekends. We would also welcome someone who is looking for evening only or night shifts.

Further details of hours available can be discussed at interview stage
